channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: KKR、16.2億ドルでのサイモン＆シュスター社買収を完了、出版業界に大きな変化をもたらす。
item.description:
New York Times:
KKR completes its $1.62B Simon & Schuster acquisition, marking a major shift in the publishing industry; KKR plans to introduce an employee profit-sharing model  —  The process of selling Simon & Schuster has been long and tumultuous, and was waylaid by an earlier antitrust suit.

item.title: パンチボール・ニュースの共同設立者ジェイク・シャーマンのプロフィール。国会議事堂のドラマをソーシャルメディアで実況中継し、DCの新鮮な情報への欲求を満たしている（Jesús Rodríguez/Washington Post）
item.description:
Jesús Rodríguez / Washington Post:
A profile of Punchbowl News co-founder Jake Sherman, whose play-by-play social media updates of Capitol Hill dramas feed DC's appetite for fresh intel  —  Jake Sherman wanted the world to know about his team's latest scoop.  —  BREAKING NEWS: DIANNE FEINSTEIN HAS PASSED AWAY AT 90, he wrote on X.

item.title: イスラエル、批判的な報道をしたベテラン紛争記者ジェシー・ローゼンフェルドの記者証を拒否、「ローリング・ストーンは報道機関ではない」と発言（ライアン・ボート／ローリング・ストーン紙）
item.description:
Ryan Bort / Rolling Stone:
Israel denies press credentials to seasoned conflict reporter Jesse Rosenfeld after critical coverage and says “Rolling Stone is not a news organization”  —  The Netanyahu administration has denied a press credential to Jesse Rosenfeld, who has reported on the prime minister and the war

item.title: GBニュースの共同経営者であり、英国最大級の政治評論サイト「UnHerd」の創設者であるポール・マーシャルがテレグラフ紙を買収する際のプロフィール（Samuel Earle/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Samuel Earle / The Guardian:
A profile of Paul Marshall, GB News co-owner and founder of UnHerd, one of the biggest websites for political commentary in the UK, as he bids for The Telegraph  —  UnHerd has quickly become one of the biggest sites for political commentary in the UK, and now the hedge fund founder behind it …

item.title: イスラエルとハマスの戦争のような重要なイベント報道から広告を削除するブランドは、これらのニュースサイクルのニュースパブリッシャーの報道の非効率的な収益化につながる（Mark Stenberg/Medialyte）
item.description:
Mark Stenberg / Medialyte:
Brands removing ads from critical event coverage, like the Israel-Hamas war, leads to inefficient monetization of news publishers' coverage of these news cycles  —  A song to read by: “Kid Charlemagne,” by Steely Dan  —  What I'm reading: “The Rachel Papers,” by Martin Amis  —  The week that was

item.title: 米国の裁判官は、3人のアーティストによるMidjourneyとDeviantArtに対するAIの著作権侵害の訴えを棄却したが、Stability AIに対する訴えの続行を認めた（Winston Cho/The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Winston Cho / The Hollywood Reporter:
A US judge dismissed AI copyright infringement claims against Midjourney and DeviantArt by three artists, but allowed a claim against Stability AI to proceed  —  While a federal judge advanced an infringement claim against Stability AI, he dismissed the rest of the lawsuit.

item.title: エル・UKのEICケニア・ハントが、年間149ポンドの会員制プログラム「エル・コレクティブ」がニューススタンドの収入減にどう対抗できるか、雑誌の未来などについてQ&A（Dominic Ponsford/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Dominic Ponsford / Press Gazette:
Q&A with Elle UK EIC Kenya Hunt on how the £149/year membership program Elle Collective can counter falling newsstand revenue, the future of magazines, and more  —  Elle UK editor in chief Kenya Hunt explains why the future is bright for Elle magazine.

item.title: ソニー・ピクチャーズ・テレビジョンの制作責任者エド・ランミは、スタジオで36年、現職で28年務めた後、2023年末に退職する予定だ（Jennifer Maas/Variety）
item.description:
Jennifer Maas / Variety:
Sony Pictures Television's head of production Ed Lammi plans to retire at the end of 2023, after 36 years at the studio and 28 years in his current position  —  No details were immediately available regarding who will replace Lammi as executive vice president of production, a role he has held since 1995.

item.title: ESPNは、2020年のNBA選手ダミアン・リラードのクリップをデジタル加工し、バックスのフィラデルフィアとの開幕戦勝利後に新しいビデオを投稿したことを確認した（Julie DiCaro/Deadspin）
item.description:
Julie DiCaro / Deadspin:
ESPN confirms digitally altering a clip of NBA player Damian Lillard from 2020 and posting the new video after the Bucks' opening night win against Philadelphia  —  The network's latest gaffe is terrifying, and likely only the beginning  —  Last week, after the Bucks' opening night win …

item.title: モルドバ、インタファクス、タス通信などロシアの報道機関のウェブサイトを遮断、親欧米政権転覆のための情報戦の一環と非難（ロイター）
item.description:
Reuters:
Moldova blocks the websites of the Interfax, TASS, and other Russian outlets, accusing them of being part of an info war to overthrow its pro-Western government  —  Moldova blocked access to the websites of major Russian news media including the Interfax and TASS news agencies on Monday …

item.title: 保守的な英国政治において長年権力を握ってきたテレグラフ紙の買収候補者について。
item.description:
Joe Pompeo / Vanity Fair:
A look at the prospective acquirers of The Telegraph, a long-standing power broker in conservative UK politics; DMGT would likely bring the newspaper to the US  —  Everyone from Rupert Murdoch to Mathias Döpfner to Lord Rothermere is eyeing the historic broadsheet, which is on the block for the first time in two decades.

item.title: アングリーバード』のような子供向けビデオゲームにイスラエル寄りのグラフィック広告が登場、イスラエルは10月7日のハマスの攻撃以来、オンライン広告に150万ドルを費やしている（ロイター）。
item.description:
Reuters:
Graphic pro-Israel ads are appearing in kids' video games, like Angry Birds, across Europe; Israel has spent $1.5M on online ads since Hamas' October 7 attack  —  Maria Julia Cassis was sitting down to a meal in her terraced home in north London when her 6-year-old son ran into the dining room, his face pale.

item.title: GroupM北米CEOのカーク・マクドナルドが退任、3年後の2023年末に退社予定、後任はマインドシェアCEOのアダム・ガーハートが暫定的に就任（Digiday）
item.description:
Digiday:
GroupM North America CEO Kirk McDonald steps down and plans to leave at 2023's end after three years, replaced by Mindshare CEO Adam Gerhart on an interim basis  —  Kirk McDonald, who has served as the CEO of GroupM North America for the past three years, is leaving his position.

item.title: 経営陣が誠実に交渉しなかった職場復帰命令をめぐり、NYTの技術スタッフ700人の大半が10月30日、半日の業務停止処分を受けた（Josh Eidelson/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Josh Eidelson / Bloomberg:
Most of the NYT's 700 tech staff held a half-day work stoppage on October 30, over a return-to-office order that management didn't negotiate in good faith  —  - News giant's Tech Guild held half-day work stoppage Monday  — Workers include software engineers and product managers

item.title: メタ社は、EU規制を遵守するため、11月6日からEUおよびその他の欧州地域で18歳未満の全ユーザーへの広告表示を一時的に停止する予定（Sam Schechner/Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Sam Schechner / Wall Street Journal:
Meta plans to temporarily suspend showing ads to all users under 18 in the EU and other parts of Europe starting on November 6, to comply with EU regulations  —  Ad changes for Instagram and Facebook owner are aimed at navigating EU rules about targeted ads
